page.title: 04COUNTRY PARK EVENTS,HORNDEAN
page.content: The Butser Fun Run. Sponsored running has recently become very popular and in 1985 the 8th Butser Fun Run took place. The course is 4.5 miles long and is run over one of the highest parts of the South Downs. It is very gruelling with some of the gradients being 1 in 5 with ascents totalling 1000 feet. There were 1050 entrants this year from a wide variety of backgrounds, local athletes,family groups, members of the forces, public house teams and individuals. The ages range from 11_69 years. There is a shorter, less severe course for those under 17. For some, the aim is to win. For others, just to finish the course will suffice. During the last seven years Â£66,000 has been raised for charity.The 1985 charities include RNLI,Cheshire Homes and the Arthritis and Rheumatism Council.
